Spring 2016 Schedule -- ONU Observatory



Friday, Feb 5, 8:00-10:00 pm. - Public Event. "Comet C/2013 Catalina"

Friday, Feb 12, 8:00-10:00 pm. - Public Event. "Where Have the Planets Gone?"

Note: The reason why the early evening sky is so devoid of bright planets is that they are all in the morning sky. Try to get up 1-2 hours before sunrise between Jan 20 and Feb 15 to see all 5 bright planets in the sky at once! For the Feb 12 event, we will view the faint planet Uranus telescopically, and then Jupiter will rise around 9 pm.

Friday, Mar 11, 9:00-11:00 pm. -- Public Event.  "Jupiter's Shrinking Red Spot"

Friday, Apr 1, 9:00-11:00 pm. -- Public Event.  "Galaxies of Spring"

Friday, Apr 15, 9:00-11:00 pm. -- Public Event.  "Craters and Maria of the Moon"

Monday, May 9,  9:00-11:00 AM. -- Public Event.  "Mercury transits the Sun!" (7:15am-2:30 pm)

Maps to the ONU Observatory: http://www2.onu.edu/~j-pinkney/astro/ONUObservatory.html
For weather cancellations see: http://www2.onu.edu/~j-pinkney/astro/publicevents.html
